what: How to get properly formatted data for spotilytics:
title: Spotilytics Vignette
text: Visit Exportify. Log Spotify SSO. Choose favorite playlist click download .csv. Load playlist data RStudio.

title: Spotilytics Vignette
text: loading playlist data Exportify, may see top 6 artists within playlist like : like see “least favorite” artists (least ones appear least playlist), change ascending argument TRUE. want see favorite artists, use count= argument just return whole dataframe, set see_all argument TRUE.
code: favorite_artists(rb) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   artist         num_appearances #>   <chr>                    <int> #> 1 Frank Ocean                  8 #> 2 SZA                          5 #> 3 Sampha                       5 #> 4 Anderson .Paak               4 #> 5 Daniel Caesar                3 #> 6 Giveon                       3 favorite_artists(rb, ascending=TRUE) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   artist          num_appearances #>   <chr>                     <int> #> 1 A$AP Rocky                    1 #> 2 André 3000                    1 #> 3 Brent Faiyaz                  1 #> 4 Bruno Mars                    1 #> 5 Drake                         1 #> 6 Earl Sweatshirt               1 favorite_artists(rb, count=10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 2 #>    artist             num_appearances #>    <chr>                        <int> #>  1 Frank Ocean                      8 #>  2 SZA                              5 #>  3 Sampha                           5 #>  4 Anderson .Paak                   4 #>  5 Daniel Caesar                    3 #>  6 Giveon                           3 #>  7 Kendrick Lamar                   3 #>  8 Mac Miller                       3 #>  9 Tyler, The Creator               3 #> 10 Childish Gambino                 2 all_artists <- favorite_artists(rb, see_all=TRUE)  all_artists #> # A tibble: 26 × 2 #>    artist             num_appearances #>    <chr>                        <int> #>  1 Frank Ocean                      8 #>  2 SZA                              5 #>  3 Sampha                           5 #>  4 Anderson .Paak                   4 #>  5 Daniel Caesar                    3 #>  6 Giveon                           3 #>  7 Kendrick Lamar                   3 #>  8 Mac Miller                       3 #>  9 Tyler, The Creator               3 #> 10 Childish Gambino                 2 #> # ℹ 16 more rows

title: Spotify data analytics
text: Spotilytics R package designed data analysis Spotify Playlists

what: Count the number of artists in your playlist — favorite_artists
title: Count the number of artists in your playlist — favorite_artists
Count the number of artists in your playlist — favorite_artists
code: favorite_artists(spotify_data, count = 6L, see_all = FALSE, ascending = FALSE)

title: Count the number of artists in your playlist — favorite_artists
text: spotify_data data.frame exportify.net count integer indicating number rows return see_all Boolean indicating function return available rows ascending Boolean orders resulting data.frame based num_appearances

title: Count the number of artists in your playlist — favorite_artists
text: data.frame ordering amount times artist appears data.frame

title: Count the number of artists in your playlist — favorite_artists
code: data('rb') favorite_artists(rb, see_all = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 26 × 2 #>    artist             num_appearances #>    <chr>                        <int> #>  1 Frank Ocean                      8 #>  2 SZA                              5 #>  3 Sampha                           5 #>  4 Anderson .Paak                   4 #>  5 Daniel Caesar                    3 #>  6 Giveon                           3 #>  7 Kendrick Lamar                   3 #>  8 Mac Miller                       3 #>  9 Tyler, The Creator               3 #> 10 Childish Gambino                 2 #> # ℹ 16 more rows
